definition: filial piety and fraternal duty
filial piety or obedience/mourning apparel
to do one's duty as a younger brother
Confucian moral injunctions of fidelity/piety to one's parents, respect to one's older brother, loyalty to one's monarch, faith to one's male friends

sentences.english: The filial and fraternal affections may be instinctive.
Commendation for filial piety is very important to the social education in Tang and Song periods.
sentences.chinese: 旌表孝悌是唐宋兩代社會教化的重要方面。

sentences.english: "Filial and piety" and "love others" are its first essence.
sentences.chinese: 孝悌“和”愛衆“是它的第一要義。

sentences.english: Filial and fraternal devotion is the traditional virtue of China.
sentences.chinese: 孝悌是中華民族傳統美德。

sentences.english: Filial piety, also for the kernel with?
sentences.chinese: 孝悌也者，其爲仁之本與？

sentences.english: Five is for the family so dear.
In order to popularize the filial concept, Emperor Xiaowen took measures in five aspects.
sentences.chinese: 爲普及孝悌觀念，孝文帝採取了五大方面的措施。

definition: Confucian moral injunctions of fidelity/piety to one's parents, respect to one's older brother, loyalty to one's monarch, faith to one's male friends
righteousness/justice
filial piety (Confucian virtue)/to be a good son or daughter
filial piety or obedience/mourning apparel
brotherly bond
affable and even-tempered
benevolence and righteousness
sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
Jente township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
benevolent integrity/high mindedness
faithful and honest/loyal and sincere
to do one's duty as a younger brother
instructions to one's children/family precepts
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
to regulate the family and rule the state (idiom)
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
the way of one's conduct and interaction in society (idiom)
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
